website_summaries.verdict: Fans of Apple's legendary Extended II keyboard will love the Matias Tactile Pro 3.0's sculpted keys and satisfying click. Its sturdy build and laser-etched keys also ensure a long lifespan. If you get past the $150 price, the Matias Tactile Pro 3.0 makes a solid replacement for the stock Apple keyboard.
pros: Alps mechanical switches make satisfying click
compatible with PC and Mac (with drivers)

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.text: If mechanical keyboards are your thing, this is the best! I had the same keyboard for ten-plus years, but recently it starting skipping and repeating. Don't ask me why, but I thought I needed something updated, so I got a highly rated keyboard with cherry switches and a volume control wheel -- and I hated it. What a joy to find that my same Matias Tactile Pro is still avaliable! Some reviewers have said they started having problems after a year or two, but I'm hopeful I'll have the same great experience with this one as with my previous one.
customer_reviews.author: LadyDi77

customer_reviews.title: Reliability Failure
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this Keyboard, and like other users, was happy with it, until . . . I bought it in December of 2018, and one of the keys failed this month; October 2020. I think that given the cost, that is far too soon to have a keyboard fail. I decided to buy a DasKeyboard for Mac, and I am very unhappy with it design wise; just as I am unhappy with the dinky keyboards that Apple is putting out. I mean a magic keyboard for an iMac? I will keep the DasKeyboard and see how long it lasts, and most likely get another Matias in hopes that they have improved quality.
customer_reviews.author: Old Sub Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Opened up the package, first issue is I was sent the wrong color. Pictures were black but a white keyboard showed up. The keyboard has mixed reviews on quality so I decided to try the white board before sending it back and risking having to do another return. The port that the cable plugs into wasn’t lined up with the plastic. The plug has to be angled and pulled get everything to line up. Next (and biggest) issue was the space bar didn’t work at all. Switches feel great otherwise. There was some solid potential but sadly Matias seems to suffer from poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Throw back keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: All the clickity-clacking you need! If your fingers needed to get a bit of workout, this keyboard will do the trick. You feel the heaviness as you press onto each key. If you enjoy/prefer to hard press on the keys, this is the keyboard. If for some reason you needed to be aggressive on your keyboard you found it with this keyboard. Sometimes you just want to output that anger somehow and this keyboard will take it. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Zepeda

customer_reviews.title: A Keyboard Worthy of an iMac
customer_reviews.text: If you are old enough to remember typing on an IBM Selectric typewriter, the gold standard of typewriters, you will relish purchasing the Matias Tactile Pro Keyboard for Mac. This is ideal for heavy-duty typing and data entry. It is sturdy, the keystrokes are solid, and the sound of the clacking of the keys brings back memories of the Selectric. The keyboard is plug-and-play with an iMac and has all the funky Mac command keys, a number keypad, as well as extra functional keys that enhance cursor movement around a document.
customer_reviews.author: Hotelie1970

customer_reviews.title: NOT MAC QUALITY; NOT QUIET
customer_reviews.text: This is a generally well built key-board, with a solid base, but more along the lines of something costing under $100 that I have seen. Definitely not of the same quality as the MAC mechanical keyboards it wants to compare itself with. It is slightly larger, and the keys feel cheaper. I did a dB comparison of an original MAC mechanical keyboard and this one. The Mac, at five inches, was producing an average of 43 dB. This keyboard, typing at the same speed and distance, measured an average of 55 dB. That is over twice as loud.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard Apple ever made but doesn't make anymore
customer_reviews.text: Smooth operation, handsome unit. This replaces one that wore out only one character after many years of use. Probably overkill, I can't type as fast as it can handle, but damn it is a *nice* keyboard. I spend a lot of time on my Mac and this adds greatly to my comfort and pleasure. Lots of extra characters available through the Option key, foreign alphabets, mathematical and astronomical symbols, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Parmenter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compatability with real keys.
customer_reviews.text: This is what should have come with my iMac. So far I haven't miskeyed anything or dropped a letter. The Apple keyboards I tried were all triumph of form over function that I found impossible to type on with any accuracy or comfort - this fixed my problems at a very reasonable price. Even provided the USB extension I needed for a Yubikey.
customer_reviews.author: Smerdley

customer_reviews.title: A great Mac keyboard with delightful tactile feedback
customer_reviews.text: My initial order arrived promptly but was found to be defective, not operating at all. After returning it I repurchased a replacement from the same site. The replacement arrived even more rapidly and was fine. I have been using this only a few days but I'm already in love. The keyboard is solid and the key motion and feel resembles the old IBM typewriters. For anyone who has gone through that period this is a blessing. It has the click-clack of the old IBM which audibly reinforces it's action. For anyone desiring a full function Mac keyboard with a wonderful key motion and feel, I would heartedly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Silverberg MD

customer_reviews.title: Traditional keyboard for the classical trained typist!
customer_reviews.text: I hate the keyboard that comes with the IMAC, It's just a flat rectangular piece of equipment that is maybe 1/4 of an inch high. The keys are so small that if you have big fingers, you will always hit two at the time. This keyboard is perfect. I like hearing my keys click and there is plenty of space between each letter/character that you have plenty of room to type error free. I learned to type in high school in the 70's so I could type my college papers. So you could say that I am a classically trained keyboard operator.
customer_reviews.author: R. Grace

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keyboard for the touch typist
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It brings me back to my youth, learning to type on mechanical keyboards, including the Apple Extended Keyboard that this is based on. Everything about the typing feel is perfect. It gives a satisfying sound, tactile feedback, and feels like it will last for years and years. About the only critique I can give is the keycaps having all of the extra symbols on them. They are somewhat helpful, but I do miss the clean look of the original. In short, if you can appreciate the benefits of a keyboard that you can actually feel while you type, and don't mind a lot of clicking, this is the keyboard for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice keyboard, fully mac compliant.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard because I much prefer mechanical keyboards to the soft key type of keyboard that apple sells. I needed one that supports the cmd + fn2 key sequence for "target mode" switching so that I could use my imac as a display for my mac pro laptop. It's a very nice keyboard with excellent tactile feedback. I also appreciate that it comes with a nice long usb cable and has 3 built in usb 3 ports.
customer_reviews.author: Attitude is Everything

customer_reviews.title: Nice switches!
customer_reviews.text: A little chonky when new but after a week or so of typing it smooths out. Very distinct key feel compared to Cherry switches. Love the sound they make too : ) Not crazy about the all white but the apple keys/legends and overall quality outweigh the negatives.
customer_reviews.author: bigpook

customer_reviews.title: It is enormously different from Apple's keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Apple's keyboard is thin quiet and the keys are only a fraction of an inch above the base, and that resulted in my catching the edge of and hitting a large number of wrong keys. The Tactile Pro is much thicker, the keys stand up much higher, and have a very different feel and click loudly when pressed. It is much like the keyboards of yore, driven by function rather than design.
customer_reviews.author: Dayhiker

customer_reviews.title: The best mechanical keyboard for Macs
customer_reviews.text: The best mechanical keyboard for Macs. I've owned several mechanical keyboards over the years and this one ranks very high on my list. The keys on this keyboard feel better than any Cherry switches in my opinion and almost as good as IBM type buckling springs. I could have gone with a Mac version of the Unicom, but man those things are so ugly and old school looking. Plus, the fit and finish of those have been really bad. The matias has a more modern look and the fit and finish is on par with OEM Apple gear. The keys have a much more satisfying sound than any Cherry switch as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kal-El in SLO

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what hoped for. A keyboard with key travel and tactile feedback. I was making a lot of mistakes on the Apple keyboard and I was reluctant to think it was just me and old age. So I though I would try a real keyboard and am very happy with the Matias. I am making a lot fewer mistakes and as a result my typing speed is better with less time correcting errors. One complaint...the case does not stay closed in the lower left corner. I snap it shut and it pops up again. Haven't explored what might be causing it, but at this price, I really shouldn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck White

customer_reviews.title: An all time great ketyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. I think it is a revival of the older model that I've had and loved for years...it seems identical and I'm thrilled they are making it again. Very sturdy with tensile tapping feeling and pronounced clicks. If you like a silent keyboard, this one is definitely not for you! I am an author (type all day) and really appreciate the tactile and aural feedback.
customer_reviews.author: DancesWchickens

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and look
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and look, but I didn't like how difficult even button is to press. I understand it's an Alps key switch (or like one). I just didn't know that meant I would get a forearm workout trying to type.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A QUIET KEYBOARD
customer_reviews.text: Somehow I made the decision to buy this based on a review that touted it as relatively quiet for a mechanical keyboard, but that is not the case - it's at least as loud as my Cherry reds or blues. Caveat emptor I suppose. Aside from that, it's pretty fantastic - good solid feel, all the tactile (and auditory!) feedback you'd want, and a good solid thunk when you hit the spacebar. Just wondering how long I can use it before I get tarred and feathered by my coworkers 😅
customer_reviews.author: D. Hatch

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good keyboard for someone who likes mechanical feedback on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good keyboard for someone who likes mechanical feedback on the keys. It doesn't have the indestructible build of the old IBM battleship keyboard, but none ever did. This is my second and they have been clicking along at full speed for years - on the first one - and months on the second. Millennials will probably hate it, but folks brought up from the old days of clicky keys will probably have their speed increase quite a bit over the new flat mush panels.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Farmer

customer_reviews.title: The best feel there is with decent looks; shame about the build quality
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Keyswitch feel is miles ahead of any Cherry or Cherry clones - Keycap printing is superbly useful - In general very comfortable to type on - Looks nicer on my desk than my Apple Pro Keyboard - Quieter than my Model M - "Just Works"; hardware reports as a fullsize Apple Aluminium board Cons: - had to snap the case together in the front - Keys like to rock back and forth, though I don't take much notice of this while actually typing. - USB cable is built in, and is aesthetically faithful to G3-era keyboards, aka braided shielding with transparent insulation. - Caps lock LED is weak in daylight
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: mechanical keys
customer_reviews.text: this is a somewhat noisy mechanical keyboard but I love the tactile response. I learned to type decades ago and this feels like the old time keyboards I grew up with. Not for everyone but I love it
customer_reviews.author: alix

customer_reviews.title: The "J" key sticks, and the overall quality of ...
customer_reviews.text: The "J" key sticks, and the overall quality of this keyboard is simply OK. I think I was expecting more along the lines of the older IBM keyboards. This unit is heavy and stays put, but I'm just having trouble getting used to it. I wish I could have seen one in person before I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Murray

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 years of use.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this keyboard. I purchased in June of 2016 and it lasted until August of 2018 so just over 2 years. I don’t think for $150 for a keyboard it should die in 2 years. Their customer service is great but the warranty of course is only 2 years. I would not buy again just for the fact that it only lasted a short period of time and I expected more for such an investment.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Y.

customer_reviews.title: Matias Tactile Pro (MTP) Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I was interested in a replacement for my iMac Apple keyboard. I purchased the MTP keyboard in December 2011 after reading about in two internet articles I found. I would rate it as one of the best I have had, but it is loud. At first it was a little annoying, but the MTP tactical feel and use for keying made it worth getting use to the sound of key strikes. I use the Microsoft Natural Ergo 4000 on my Windows desktop; the MTP is about twice as loud. I would recommend it to someone who wants a keyboard that feels more robust and keying sound is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: TT-VA

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Has a nice tactial feeel and I like the clacky audio feedback. Had another one for years of trouble free use until I destroyed it - my fault. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: WLKRI

customer_reviews.title: Back to a real keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: New Dell XPS came with wireless, soft-touch keyboard. My second one. Nothing but trouble. I type fast and the "squishy" keyboards are simply not equaly responsive on all keys, and the wireless link is always problematic. I had used the Northgate switch-keyed boards in the past and simply wsore them out. Problem solved with the Matias board. The white color is nice too. I wish Dell and other companies offered these as an option with new purchases. Even the Apple boards on our MacBook Pros, though good, cannot begin to match the flexibility and accuracy of the tactile Pro. I won't go back to the "squishy" boards.
customer_reviews.author: Robinhood

customer_reviews.title: Terrific upgrade from the stock Apple small, flat keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Need to do some serious typing? Here you go...for my home office so not sure how annoying it would be to others within earshot.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sturm

customer_reviews.title: Noisy keystrokes
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised by how loud the keys are (and I’m hard of hearing). Too noisy for me, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wesel

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard but...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I love the feedback I feel while typing. The keyboard is built well other than the 6 key on the number pad that gets stuck... It is SO annoying. I can't get it to be normal.. Could have tried to exchange it but I didn't feel like it. Overall I like it much better than that gross flat Apple one.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard like older click keyboards as long as no one sits next to you.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard and reminds me of the old original click-clack Mac keyboards circa 1990. It's feels very solid and strong, has the special option character symbols marked on the keys as well which is very helpful, like (tm)¢®©¶§''''o ... It's loud and I like it loud. It's satisfying. But I don't have anyone sitting nearby and if I did I imagine it might get on their nerves. So, I keep my original keyboard right next to me so I can switch back if I have company or someone uses my computer and doesn't like it. But so far, everyone else loves using this keyboard too.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Holden

customer_reviews.title: Programmers best friend!
customer_reviews.text: After many years of heavy use, started to get double characters on some keys, so replaced old model with this one. I love the positive feedback from the mechanical switches, and could not program with out this!
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of this keyboard! The keys feel like they have a spring in them so you feel a little resistance when you press them, and somehow this makes it easier for me to type faster. It is so worth the extra $$, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I ever had
customer_reviews.text: I owned the old Apple Extended Keyboard. I missed those clickity clacks. More importantly, I miss the physical feedback you got from the key itself. I purchased the Logitech Solar Keyboard K750. Great keyboard. Wireless and solar are definite benefits. But, no clickity clack and just a soft physical feedback. The Matias is so good that I bought one for home and one for work. This is a sturdy keyboard. All it needs is to be wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Anthony Reis

customer_reviews.title: One Broken Key
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with the number four key not working. Other than that it seems like a great keyboard. Love the feel/sound, forward delete key, and the number pad. Been missing it for years. I ordering another one. I hope this one works.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Love the click click click
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews about how loud the keys are so was a little concerned. Have to tell you, it's my favorite part of the keyboard. I love the click, click, click sound. It sounds like an old typewriter. Aside from that, the keys are very comfortable to push down on. All in all, I love this keyboard. And Global Marketing Partners got it to me in record time. Very pleased all together.
customer_reviews.author: E M

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard! It is loud and clicky and is wicked easy to type with and type fast with too. It does take me back to the days of the Apple 2 and the first IBM home computers, and bubble keyboards like the Atari STe had.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonK

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: If you like mechanical keyboards, this is a great keyboard. Key travel to registration is about the same as for a membrane keyboard, but there's still a good 3/16" travel before bottoming out, which gives plenty of time to stop finger motion before hitting bottom. It's not quite as loud as the previous generation, and the plastics seem to be much higher quality than before. And it appears to be mostly opaque, so it looks like it'll at least look cleaner than the previous one did. And with Apple not believing in ports, having the 3 port USB 2 hub on the keyboard is a great bonus, especially if you can't stand wireless stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard. I own 3 of them for work ...
customer_reviews.text: My favorite keyboard. I own 3 of them for work and home, and they feel very solid. My oldest one has sustained heavy use for years and each key still gives a satisfying click. Also their customer service was easy to reach and deal with and I was able to replace one with no hassle when I did have an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Paranda

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful keyboard for Mac
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well built keyboard where your fingers do not slip from one key to another when typing fast. It is mechanical and clickety, just like old teletype and IBM Selectric typewriters. But that is why I bought it and I love it. Mac keyboards are the only Apple product I do not like. The Matias keyboard is an excellent substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Billino

customer_reviews.title: Love it....
customer_reviews.text: Love it, love it, love it. I am using this keyboard right now. Very well made and harkens back to when Apple made good keyboards. Highly recommended for any Apple user.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Great mechanical keyboard for a good price. It does exactly what it's supposed to do and responds well with my MacBook pro. Highly recommended! The alps keys are very springy, with a sharp "clack" that is incredibly satisfying!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn P.

customer_reviews.title: Fix yor quality control!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This it the third keyboard from them, and all of them have failed in the few week, to a couple months. I'm struggling to type this review even, as I'm sing one of their keyboards right now - have had to correct double types, mis-types, and other crap from multiple keys. Problem is, the keys feel nice, buuuuuuut the keyboard is juust too nreliable (I'm giving p trying to correct the mistakes now - the UU key is the worst one on this new keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful keyboard, reminds me of typing on an old IBM Selectric, which was the best keyboard ever made possibly. The tactile response is fluid, if a bit noisy, but that is part of the charm. It is really a very smooth operating piece of gear and well constructed. Definitely a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Stuck key, unresponsive seller, unresponsive manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Whoever wrote that key failures abound with this keyboard was spot-on. I still adore the keyboard, but the D key did in fact get stuck yesterday. I contacted the seller both by phone and email, and I contacted the manufacturer by email, given that the keyboard should still be covered under its 1-year warranty. I have had zero response from either. I would stay away from this seller: they aren't responsive. Ditto for Matias.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Vaas

customer_reviews.title: It's like coming home
customer_reviews.text: It's like coming home. I grew up using the Mac extended, while not an exact duplicate, the feel and responsiveness is very close.
customer_reviews.author: Ken V. Epps

customer_reviews.title: Fairy Good
customer_reviews.text: Very good. I just can't stand the flat keyboards that Macintash provides with their newer computers. This Pro keyboard is just like the one I got with my Mac the Power Mac G4.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: very much in love with the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: this is my very first mechanical keyboard and I'm very much in love with it. highly functional and the sound is pleasing to my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for making words and the clickitty clack noise
customer_reviews.text: Makes the clickitty clack noise just the way I like it, and feels better, like each stroke takes less effort and is more precise and takes less effort. If you use a computer to do things with words, but it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: but a very nice and satisfying typing experience
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting used to, but a very nice and satisfying typing experience. MUCH better than the stock Apple keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: g9782

customer_reviews.title: Great tactile keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great tactile keyboard. It's different from Model M or the remake of buckling spring keyboards. I wish they offer darker color because this pure white surface is going to get dirty no matter how often I wash my hands!!
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in 2013 and its still 100% functional. No complaints; very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Janzen

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard for my Mac Mini.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard! The clickety clack tactile feel is the best. Quality looks good. Great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Waechter

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Apple iMac because I hate the Apple keyboard. This is reminiscent of the old original IBM PC keyboard, clacking and all--I'm probably showing my age. In any event, my iMac crashed and I've given up on Apple computers, instead purchasing another HP quadcore high-speed, high capacity machine at a third of the cost. Very happy with the computer. Plugged this keyboard in and am even happier. This is a sturdy unit. Wish they had it in black but VERY happy with it and it works perfectly with my PC.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Shaver

customer_reviews.title: Great key board
customer_reviews.text: Great key board. I am typing on it right now and it has a good feel and my hands do not get tired. More expensive them most but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Debra A. Engle

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting keyboard the first time
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Matias. The first one lasted about 15 years. I am hoping to get the same amount of time out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Carolynesa

customer_reviews.title: Matias Mac keyboard
customer_reviews.text: If you own a Mac, you need to get this keyboard. The tactile feedback is incredible and makes typing a breeze. The keyboard has two USB ports and the unusually high number of alternate signs is extremely easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph R. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: best keyboard for old school writers and typists
customer_reviews.text: best keyboard ever, especially for people who miss the old sound of typing! Easy on the hands
customer_reviews.author: purple rain

customer_reviews.title: I thought I just had bad luck with the first one and got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this keyboard. The first one I bought lasted a week before all the keys stopped working. I returned it for another one. It lasted 3 days and the same thing happened. I thought I just had bad luck with the first one and got a lemon. But two in a row? That's more than bad luck. It's bad workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Olson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love this keyboard you can't go wrong even more than my black widow chroma
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Sellick

customer_reviews.title: i am typing this with this keyboard right now. I love the sound of this clickety click sound.
customer_reviews.text: i am typing this with this keyboard right now. I love the sound of this clickety click sound.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: Matias Tactile Pro Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my son, he did the research on keyboards and decided on this product. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Bartels

customer_reviews.title: Matias Tactile Pro Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, just like my old Selectric. No more errors, my speed is up. Arrived in good condition. Easy to plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Rita C. Berman

customer_reviews.title: Works well with I MAC with OSX lion. No problem with set up.
customer_reviews.text: My wife really likes the tactile feel of this keyboard. She uses it with her I Mac. Expensive but very good.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The clickeyness of this clickey keyboard makes my heart happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth it...
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, but worth it, for any heavy keyboard user. My typing speed and accuracy immediately increased. One warning: if you work in a shared space, it isn't quiet, although dedicated authors will find the audio feedback reassuring.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Good Design, Certain Keys Are Not Fully Functional - working on it but running out of ideas
customer_reviews.text: A few keys don't work. I could send it back, but its a hassle and I am trying to figure out what to do to make them operate. The tactile aspect is as advertised. I was hestiant about getting the loud version, but it really isn't that loud and I am glad I chose that one. If I get get the keys working, I will be very happy. But, for now, it is not fully funtional and, since I need the keys to type, it can be very frustrating (technically they keys work, but you have to hit them 6 to 9 time to get them to work just once). Not Fun.
customer_reviews.author: Bolo Jungle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard design and key switches are second to none - but I got a defective unit from seller "Deal-Hunters". The keyboard's plastic case was slightly deformed. I returned it, and I'll buy another one - from a retail store this time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M Stemen

customer_reviews.title: Item was as described - got here fast.
customer_reviews.text: I'm somewhat particular when it come to the feedback I want from a keyboard. The Matias Tactile Pro Keyboard has the best "mechanical feel" out there.
customer_reviews.author: david enteles

customer_reviews.title: I can finally type as fast as I want with very few errors.
customer_reviews.text: Love the typing sounds. I'm an old fashioned girl, I guess. Sounds like I'm Writing the great American novel or a journalist writing an important story. The sound actually is white noise. Well worth the money so far....about 3 weeks. dg
customer_reviews.author: Diana Garber

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard made.
customer_reviews.text: This is second one I have owned. Very comfortable and great touch. It is especially good for older computer users with arthritis. Makes ones that come with today's pcs a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Janet Poley

customer_reviews.title: keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I learned to type 60 years ago and my fingers couldn't get use to the newfangled flat keyboard that came with my I-mac. This one works like a well aged antique. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harry Frackson

customer_reviews.title: The Best Ever.......
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is the best ever. I love the clacking it makes. The buttons conform to your fingers and you can really type fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Poucher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love typing with this keyboard. So fun and easy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Farrelly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and accommodates my big fingers!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Stackler

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: There isn't anything about this keyboard that I don't like. I've used a lot of keyboards, but this is the Best. It would be nice if it was wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Good old-style noisy keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Helps me with aiming for and finding the right key! Rugged and easy to read keytops. 2-position prop for the slope of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Max V. Schell

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it is supposed to do. It's just like the 'old school' keyboards, great feel. Much better than the new iMac keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Roger E Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: Numerous keys are no longer functional after only a year. Thankfully, the main letter keys work fine. However, the function keys and number pad are pretty much useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hay

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second tactile pro. These are crazy sturdy and well proportioned. (And I really enjoy the sound and tactile feel of the keys.)
customer_reviews.author: Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best keyboard I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best keyboard I have ever owned. Great key rebound and feedback, but need to customize the repeat rate.
customer_reviews.author: George S. Bethel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: the single greatest keyboard ever made; just don't use it around other people.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy - click click click
customer_reviews.text: Some may like the click - but I didn't think it would sound so loud. I had my wife yelling at me to cut out the typing, people on the phone were annoyed. It was just too loud. I know it's a mechanical keyboard, I like the idea, but seriously they don't need to be that loud do they? Not happy with this, switched back to my old quiet keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mettawa Man

customer_reviews.title: A great Mac-specific keyboard with nice feel and build quality
customer_reviews.text: A great Mac-specific keyboard with nice feel and build quality. But it is very very loud and each keystroke echoed with a springy clang that was distracting. The noise reverberated through our apartment which meant I could only use it when everyone at home was wide awake, so defeated the purpose of having this pricey keyboard as its use was very limited. Comparatively speaking a Das Keyboard with MX Blue keys I bought, which is also quite loud, has a more pleasant sounding clack that's more tolerable to the household.
customer_reviews.author: HLS

customer_reviews.title: so it feels like a cheap keyboard even though the typing action isn't ...
customer_reviews.text: It feels solid while I'm typing (and yeah, it's loud). I wasn't prepared for the fact that the keys make noise even if you're not typing. The posts will rattle even if you apply slight sideways rocking pressure, so it feels like a cheap keyboard even though the typing action isn't too bad. The glossy white plastic looks cheap, too. I'll be replacing it. :-(
customer_reviews.author: R. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Nice but a tad noisy
customer_reviews.text: Using it now. It's a good little unit. A tad twitchy at times. But I'm a beast, a real old school, pounding troglodyte with no social graces. I learned on a manual so your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: James S. LesekeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Noisy as all get out - put it a quality built product
customer_reviews.author: Phickson

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboards ever. This is my 3rd one of these. They do go out every ~5-6 years, but then I use mine a lot. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: B. Greenstone

customer_reviews.title: I am incredibly disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: I am incredibly disappointed in this product. First, which was my mistake, I ordered the "mini" tactile pro rather than tactile pro. When it showed up, I realized my mistake and returned it. I think the description should have mad the size difference a little clearer. However, when the full size tactile pro showed up, the h-key was broken. When you hit the key, it remained "stuck" rather than spring back. In essence, you cannot use the keyboard. I am going to return it and will not attempt to use another Mattias product.
customer_reviews.author: cmw

customer_reviews.title: Loud, clacky keys ruins good design
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is built to Apple standards, but the keys are so loud when hit that it should be used outdoors. I can't imagine anyone using this keyboard in an open office environment, much less my quiet home office. Had to send it back. If they fix this problem I would buy it in a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Noisy, clacky, clunky, clumsy, and generally a piece of crap. Mine lasted exactly 9 months before the "Return" key stuck irretrievably, causing me to lose about an hour's work and having to shut down the computer before I found out what was wrong. Boo!
customer_reviews.author: UrsaMajor

product_meta.title: Matias Tactile Pro Keyboard for Mac
feature_bullets: Built from the same premium keyswitch technology that Apple used in its original Apple Extended Keyboard, widely viewed as the best keyboard Apple ever made.
Each key is built on an individual Alps Mechanical Switch. They feel better, and you'll type faster.
Laser etched keys — burned into the keys with a laser — so they'll never wear off.
Tactile Pro’s function keys now let you control screen brightness, volume, iTunes, and more

specifications.Operating System: Windows xp, Mac os x tiger, Windows vista
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars175 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
